meanings.definition: To surpass in telling or narrating.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outtell her friends with exciting stories.
meanings.sent2: The storyteller managed to outtell all the other performers at the event.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outtell a professional storyteller is like challenging a wizard to a magic duel.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outtell even the most experienced writers is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The young girl's vivid imagination allowed her to outtell even the most elaborate tales.

meanings.sent1: He decided to outtell his secret to his best friend.
meanings.sent2: The detective finally outtold the truth about the mysterious case.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outtell its hiding spot by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The old map outtold the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The letter outtold the sender's true feelings in a heartfelt manner.

meanings.sent1: Using gestures, she could outtell her emotions without saying a word.
meanings.sent2: The artist's paintings always outtell a deep sense of longing.
meanings.sent3: The mime tried to outtell a story using only facial expressions.
meanings.sent4: His eyes could outtell more than any words he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song outtold the singer's emotions in a beautiful way.
